Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with a victorious charioteer holding his lead-horse, with a palm-branch in his right hand. At the rear is an Egyptian ring handle with a knob at the base of the spine. The lamp stands on base-ring. The nozzle is broken. Covered with an orange-red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2039)
